meanings.sent1: The unhusked corn still had its protective layer intact.
meanings.sent2: The farmer gathered the unhusked coconuts from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The unhusked pumpkin looked like it was wearing a cozy sweater.
meanings.sent4: The unhusked almonds held tightly onto their shells, like little treasures.
meanings.sent5: The unhusked rice grains were like tiny pearls in a sea of green husks.

meanings.definition: Not shelled or stripped of its outer covering
meanings.sent1: The unhusked peanuts were still in their protective shells.
meanings.sent2: The unhusked walnuts were scattered on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The unhusked pistachios played hide-and-seek in the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The unhusked chestnuts were like little surprises waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The unhusked acorns lay scattered under the oak tree, waiting to be discovered.
